page.title: 16MONYASH CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: {Monyash School Conservation Area was opened by{Mr. Chris Baines}a wildlife gardening expert,on Friday June 14th 1985. Work on the Conservation Area was started in the Autumn of 1982. The children adopted a 20m x 30m corner of {St.Leonard's Churchyard. The idea was to create separate {mini_habitats}in which a variety of wild_life would live.There is a pond,a rotting log area,an edge of woodland area,a long grass area,a butterfly garden, wildflower area,fruiting bush area and a hedge. The children have built and put up three nest boxes and a bat box. The school uses the conservation area as a{resource area}to study wildlife like insects, birds, pond life, different mammals and butterflies.
